description:
Reproduction scenario:
*/ create volume with installed OS (for example vol-00000001)
*/ create instance with block device mapping where vol-00000001 will be root device
$ euca-run-instances ami-00000001 -z nova -g default -t m1.small --block-device-mapping /dev/vda=vol-00000001::false
*/ instance is created without selected device mapping
$ virsh dumpxml i-000000xy
...
    <disk type='file' device='disk'>
      <driver name='qemu' type='qcow2' cache='none'/>
      <source file='/var/lib/nova/instances/i-0000008c/disk'/>
      <target dev='vda' bus='virtio'/>
      <alias name='virtio-disk0'/>
      <address type='pci' domain='0x0000' bus='0x00' slot='0x04' function='0x0'/>
    </disk>
...
$ mysql nova -e 'select * from block_device_mapping where deleted=0 and device_name="/dev/vda";'
+---------------------+------------+------------+---------+----+-------------+-------------+-----------------------+--------------+-------------+-----------+-------------+-----------+-----------------+
| created_at          | updated_at | deleted_at | deleted | id | instance_id | device_name | delete_on_termination | virtual_name | snapshot_id | volume_id | volume_size | no_device | connection_info |
+---------------------+------------+------------+---------+----+-------------+-------------+-----------------------+--------------+-------------+-----------+-------------+-----------+-----------------+
| 2012-06-01 12:53:21 | NULL       | NULL       |       0 | 55 |         150 | /dev/vda    |                     0 | NULL         |        NULL |      NULL |        NULL |      NULL | NULL            |
+---------------------+------------+------------+---------+----+-------------+-------------+-----------------------+--------------+-------------+-----------+-------------+-----------+-----------------+

comments.content: Are you using devstack? Is the volume you created empty? So far an image needs to be copied to the volume. Please check the script boot_from_volume.sh under /devstack/exercises, which tells you how to boot from the volume device.
